author: Special Correspondent
text:
The J.J. Nagar police have arrested a gang of four who were allegedly behind a spate of motorcycle thefts in the city. As many as 19 motorcycles worth Rs. 12.7 lakh were recovered from them. According to the police, the accused Kumar (25) from Mudalapalya and Anil Kumar (24) from Ramanagaram would steal bikes parked outside houses using duplicate keys. The third accused, Mohan (25), also from Ramanagaram, would sell the bikes to his contact Vedachalam (28) from Andhra Pradesh.

Kumar and Anil were arrested by the J.J. Nagar police based on a tip off. The two confessed to the crime. Based on their statement, the police recovered the vehicles which they said they had stolen.
title: TAMIL NADU
